intro: Mildbraedia paniculata subsp. paniculata, commonly known as the white-flowered mildbraedia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white, umbel-like inflorescences. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of its family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
